title: Serbian Cyrillic fancies wanted
content:
Can anyone point at some interesting reference material upon [Cyrillic](http://web.archive.org/web/20090828032732/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Cyrillic) lettering in [Serbia](http://web.archive.org/web/20090828032732/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Serbia) (and perhaps Montenegro)?  
Apart from [that instructive discussion](http://web.archive.org/web/20090828032732/http:/jankojs.tripod.com/SerbianCyr.htm) regarding mainly Italics I’m interested in possible other special customs which differ from standard (Russian) practice.  
Any images of old type, street lettering, shop signs etc. known?
author: Andreas Stötzner

comments.content:
The site is an excellent recommendation.  
I enjoyed the chapters on [Miloš Ćirić](http://web.archive.org/web/20090828032732/http:/www.tipometar.org/kolumne/CirinaSlova/IndexEng.html) and the funny [overhaed cable alphabet](http://web.archive.org/web/20090828032732/http:/www.tipometar.org/kaleidoskop/Trole/IndexEng.html) in particular.

By the way, I’m wondering why Typophile still does not allow me to see text with certain accented letters undisturbed by font fallbacks …
